message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the adaptations of different animals to their environments. Porpoises are mammals that are built to move through wet currents because they have streamlined bodies and strong muscles that allow them to swim efficiently in water. Option (A) is incorrect because humans are not specifically built for moving through wet currents. Option (C) is incorrect because cats are not adapted for moving through water. Option (D) is incorrect because birds are adapted for flying, not swimming through wet currents.
